elements.label: Workspace
elements.helpText:
The selected folder is used as the workspace where all intermediate and output files will be written.

If the selected folder does not exist, it will be created.

If datasets already exist in the selected folder, they will be overwritten.

elements.label: Digital Elevation Model (Raster)
elements.helpText: A GDAL-supported raster file containing a base Digital Elevation Model to execute the routing functionality across.

elements.label: Pit Filled DEM Filename
elements.helpText: The filename of the output raster with pits filled in. It will go in the project workspace.

elements.label: Flow Direction Filename
elements.helpText: The filename of the flow direction raster. It will go in the project workspace.

elements.label: Flow Accumulation Filename
elements.helpText: The filename of the flow accumulation raster. It will go in the project workspace.

elements.label: Threshold Flow Accumulation
elements.helpText: The number of upstream cells that must flow into a cell before it's classified as a stream.

elements.label: Calculate Multiple Stream Thresholds
elements.helpText: Select to calculate multiple stream maps. If enabled set stream threshold to lowest amount, then set upper and step size thresholds.

elements.label: Threshold Flow Accumulation Upper Limit
elements.helpText: The number of upstream cells that must flow into a cell before it's classified as a stream.

elements.label: Threshold Flow Accumulation Range Stepsize
elements.helpText: The number cells to step up from lower to upper threshold range.

elements.label: Calculate Slope
elements.helpText: Select to output a slope raster.

elements.label: Slope Filename
elements.helpText: The filename of the output slope raster. It will go in the project workspace.

elements.label: Calculate Distance to stream
elements.helpText: Select to calculate a distance to stream raster, based on uppper threshold limit.

elements.label: Downstream Distance Filename
elements.helpText: The filename of the output slope raster. It will go in the project workspace.
